title: How to Make Cognac Wreaths

steps.headline: Place the flour onto a wooden cutting board.
Cut the flour directly into the flour on the board.
Sprinkle the flour and butter with the cognac and sugar.
Place in a cool place overnight.
steps.description: Cover with a damp tea towel if you have concerns about insects etc.

steps.headline: Roll out the dough into 8"/20 centimeter (7.9 in) strips length and about the thickness of a pencil.
steps.description: Fold the strips in half and twist them.

steps.headline: Continue to fold into a wreath shape and pinch the ends together to join the cookie.
Place each cognac wreath cookie onto a pre-greased cookie sheet.
Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes.
steps.description: Remove and cool on a wire cake rack.

text: Place the flour onto a wooden cutting board.  Cut the flour directly into the flour on the board.  Sprinkle the flour and butter with the cognac and sugar.  Knead well.  Place in a cool place overnight. Cover with a damp tea towel if you have concerns about insects etc. Preheat the oven to 350ºF-400ºF/175ºC-200ºC.  Roll out the dough into 8"/20 centimeter (7.9 in) strips length and about the thickness of a pencil. Fold the strips in half and twist them. Continue to fold into a wreath shape and pinch the ends together to join the cookie.  Place each cognac wreath cookie onto a pre-greased cookie sheet.  Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes. Remove and cool on a wire cake rack. Finished!
